title: Level 4 & 5 Accounting and Finance
overview: Our Accounting and Finance course provides essential knowledge in financial reporting, budgeting, auditing, and corporate finance. Accredited by Qualifi, this course equips students with the skills needed for careers in financial management, accounting, and strategic planning.
description: This online course offers flexible learning and covers key financial concepts, including budgeting, investment management, risk assessment, and compliance. Students can complete a Level 4, Level 5, or combined Level 4 & 5 Qualifi diploma, enabling them to advance in the finance industry or pursue further education.
study_pace: Flexible, up to 5 years to complete
subtitle: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free.
subtitle2: From £120 per month, or £2,900 per level
subtitle3: From £145 per month, or £3,500 for both levels

section.title: How It Works
content: Students on our Accounting and Finance course can complete a Level 4 (120 credits), Level 5 (120 credits) or a combined Level 4 & 5 (240 credits) Qualifi diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the finance industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, offering complete flexibility. Each module (Level 4 & 5) consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you'll submit 6 online assignments at each level, with assignments being approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you've passed your course, you'll be awarded with a Qualifi diploma and you'll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor's degree at a range of UK universities.
During the course you'll benefit from 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, along with social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease.

Throughout your studies, you'll have access to various support resources to enhance your learning experience, including personalized tutor support, interactive webinars, collaborative learning forums, and comprehensive study materials.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Subject Content
modules1: This Level 4/5 diploma in Accounting and Management includes 10 modules and 6 written assignments at each level. Assignments are 2,000–3,000 words each. Students receive support via the ‘Tutor’ section of the learning platform.

sublists.name: The Business Environment
sublists.description: Explore external factors that affect businesses, including economics, international dimensions, nature, and competition.

sublists.name: Managing and Using Finance
sublists.description: Understand key accounting areas and how they inform management decisions.

sublists.name: Maximizing Resources to Achieve Business Success
sublists.description: Learn how to effectively manage resources for profitability.

sublists.name: Quantitative Skills
sublists.description: Develop knowledge of numeric exercises and their application in business.

sublists.name: Basic Accounting
sublists.description: Understand accounts and their use in assessing organizational health.

sublists.name: Budgetary Control
sublists.description: Learn about financial control methods using budgets.

sublists.name: Financial Performance
sublists.description: Assess financial performance using financial statements and accounting standards.

sublists.name: Financial Ratios
sublists.description: Understand the application and meaning of common financial ratios.

sublists.name: Financial Statements
sublists.description: Learn how to prepare and present financial statements.

sublists.name: Further Ratios
sublists.description: Determine financial efficiency and assess future financial success.

modules2: The Level 5 diploma in Business Management contains the following modules:

sublists.name: The Entrepreneurial Manager
sublists.description: Explore the characteristics and skills of entrepreneurs, including innovation, risk-taking, leadership, and problem-solving.

sublists.name: Organisational Structures
sublists.description: Understand the factors that influence organisational structure, such as size, industry, culture, and strategy.

sublists.name: Practical Accounting Analysis
sublists.description: Analyse accounts to gain insights into financial performance, identify trends, and inform decision-making.

sublists.name: Business Planning and Goal Setting
sublists.description: Develop clear goals and objectives for a business, create a strategic plan, and allocate resources effectively.

sublists.name: Politics and Business
sublists.description: Explore the impact of political factors on business, including government policies, regulations, and economic conditions.

sublists.name: Business Law
sublists.description: Understand the legal responsibilities of managers, including employment law, contract law, and corporate governance.

sublists.name: Managing in Today’s World
sublists.description: Explore modern business practices, such as sustainability, corporate social responsibility, and ethical leadership.

sublists.name: Performance Management
sublists.description: Improve employee and business performance through strategies such as performance reviews, goal setting, and training and development.

sublists.name: Marketing and Sales Planning
sublists.description: Develop a comprehensive marketing and sales plan, including market research, target market identification, product positioning, and sales strategies.

sublists.name: Quantitative Skills
sublists.description: Acquire knowledge of numeric exercises and their application in business, including financial analysis, data analysis, and statistical modelling.

sublists: Responding to the changing business environment

section.title: Entry Requirements
section.heading: Am I eligible for this programme?
content: To enrol in our Level 4 Accounting and Finance course, you must be at least 18 years old and have a full secondary education (minimum of 2 A-levels or equivalent).
If you don't have 2 A-levels or equivalent qualifications (such as NVQ Level 3), you may still be eligible based on relevant work experience.
For the Level 5 Accounting and Finance course, you must have successfully completed the Level 4 Qualifi diploma in Accounting and Finance.
Contact our admissions team at 0333 772 1158 to discuss your eligibility or if you have any questions about the entry requirements.

section.title: University Progression
content: Once you've completed your online Level 4 & 5 Accounting and Finance course you have the opportunity to complete a third-year Accounting and Finance degree programme, known as a 'BA top up', from a wide range of UK universities.
Students can apply to any university offering the BA top up and you can choose to study for your degree either online or in-person on campus.
If you decide to top up to a full undergraduate degree through an accredited UK university, the costs are listed below.
NOTE: UK/EU students may be eligible for student loans for the top-up portion of their studies. Visit www.slc.co.uk for more information.

title: Level 4 & 5  Business Management
overview: Our Business Management course is designed to develop leadership, strategic planning, and operational management skills. Accredited by Qualifi, this course prepares students for careers in corporate management, entrepreneurship, and business operations.
description: Covering business strategy, HR management, marketing, and financial planning, this online course offers a flexible pathway to a diploma and further university studies. The program is ideal for aspiring business professionals seeking comprehensive management knowledge.

section.title: How it Works
content: Students enrolled on our Diploma in Business Management course can complete a Level 4 (120 credits), Level 5 (120 credits) or a combined Level 4 & 5 (240 credits) Qualifi diploma, designed to provide students with business management skills for career success.

This online course offers complete flexibility - start and study at any time. Each module (Level 4 & 5) includes 40 hours of guided online learning plus 30-50 hours of optional materials (exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks).
To complete the course, you'll submit 6 online assignments per level (2,000-3,000 words each). Upon passing, you'll receive a Qualifi Diploma and can top up to a bachelor's degree at UK universities.

You'll benefit from 1-2-1 tutor support, webinars, social learning forums, and additional materials throughout your Business Management studies. Visit our Student Resources page for more support information.

title: Level 4 & 5  Health and Social Care
description: Dream of making a difference in people’s lives through a career in health and social care? From patient care and support to health administration and community outreach – our Health and Social Care Course can set you on the path to success.

section.title: How it Works
content: Students on our Health and Social Care course can complete a Level 4 Diploma in Health and Social Care (120 credits), a Level 5 Diploma in Health and Social Care (120 credits) or a combined Level 4 & 5 (240 credits) Qualifi diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the Health and Social Care industry.

This Health and Social Care course is completed online and you can start at any time, it's completely flexible. Each module (Level 4 & Level 5) consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete this online Health and Social Care course you'll submit 6 online written assignments at Level 4, and 5 online written assignments at Level 5. Assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you've passed your course, you'll be awarded with a Qualifi Health and Social Care diploma and you'll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor's degree at a range of UK universities.

During this Health and Social Care course you'll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to help you complete your Health and Social Care diploma with ease. You can find out more about the support available on our Student Resources page, including details about our academic credentials and professional associations that ensure you receive the best learning experience.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Subject Content
modules1: The Level 4 Diploma in Health and Social Care includes 6 modules focused on foundational knowledge, communication, and reflective practice.

sublists.name: Academic Study Skills
sublists.description: Develop effective study skills and critical thinking abilities for higher education success.

sublists.name: Communicating in Health and Social Care
sublists.description: Understand and apply various forms of communication for effective service delivery in care settings.

sublists.name: An Introduction to Healthcare Policy
sublists.description: Examine influences on healthcare and evaluate key contemporary issues in healthcare policy.

sublists.name: Reflective Practice
sublists.description: Explore reflective practice to connect theory with real-world care delivery and personal development.

sublists.name: Managing People in Health and Social Care
sublists.description: Understand recruitment, management, and organizational change in the care sector.

sublists.name: Sociology: Concepts in Health and Ill Health
sublists.description: Study how social structures influence perceptions of health and well-being.

modules2: The Level 5 Diploma in Health and Social Care includes 5 advanced modules focused on professional values, quality management, and complex care needs.

sublists.name: Principles Underpinning Health and Social Care
sublists.description: Understand professional values, codes of conduct, and mechanisms promoting good practice.

sublists.name: The Management of Quality in Health and Social Care
sublists.description: Evaluate different perspectives of service quality and empower service users through involvement.

sublists.name: Research Project
sublists.description: Conduct a pilot investigation to build skills in enquiry, analysis, and professional development.

sublists.name: Partnership Working in Health and Social Care
sublists.description: Explore service user empowerment, inter-professional collaboration, and organizational partnerships.

sublists.name: Working with Service Users with Complex Needs
sublists.description: Understand issues in complex care and empower users to lead their care decisions.

sublists: Communicating in Health and Social Care
Managing People in Health and Social Care
Sociology: Concepts in Health and Ill Health
Principles Underpinning Health and Social Care
The Management of Quality in Health and Social Care
Partnership Working in Health and Social Care

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Hospitality and Tourism Management Content
modules1: The Level 4 Diploma in Hospitality and Tourism Management includes 10 modules that cover the core aspects of hospitality operations and management.

sublists.name: Food and Beverage Operations
sublists.description: Understand processes in food and beverage production and service.

sublists.name: Food Safety and Hygiene
sublists.description: Learn about regulations and procedures to ensure food safety.

sublists.name: Hospitality and Hotel Housekeeping
sublists.description: Explore the role and impact of housekeeping in hospitality operations.

sublists.name: Customer Service
sublists.description: Gain skills in meeting customer expectations and delivering excellent service.

sublists.name: Front Office Operations
sublists.description: Understand the front office’s function and influence in hospitality environments.

sublists.name: Accounting and Cost Control
sublists.description: Study financial principles and accounting techniques relevant to hospitality.

sublists.name: Global Tourism and Hospitality
sublists.description: Examine the scale, scope, and brand influence in the global hospitality industry.

sublists.name: Hospitality and Marketing
sublists.description: Learn marketing principles and how to apply them within the hospitality industry.

sublists.name: Employee Engagement
sublists.description: Understand strategies to engage employees and their impact on performance.

sublists.name: Training and CPD
sublists.description: Develop training programs and understand continuous professional development in hospitality.

modules2: The Level 5 Diploma in Hospitality and Tourism Management contains 10 modules designed to advance strategic understanding in key operational areas.

sublists.name: Food and Beverage Supply Chain Management
sublists.description: Learn supply chain systems for domestic and global hospitality operations.

sublists.name: Quality Management
sublists.description: Understand and implement quality systems in hospitality organizations.

sublists.name: Events and Conference Management
sublists.description: Explore the processes behind planning and delivering successful events.

sublists.name: Customer Relations Management
sublists.description: Understand the role of CRM and how to maintain effective customer relations.

sublists.name: Managing People
sublists.description: Study management styles, organizational culture, and staff performance.

sublists.name: Current Issues in HRM
sublists.description: Examine modern HR challenges, including legislative impacts on HR practices.

sublists.name: Revenue Management
sublists.description: Learn yield and pricing strategies in hotel operations.

sublists.name: Corporate Social Responsibility
sublists.description: Explore sustainability and CSR practices within hospitality.

sublists.name: Contemporary Issues
sublists.description: Assess how the hospitality sector responds to rapid change and market demands.

sublists.name: Business Planning
sublists.description: Develop business plans, assess market positions, and explore growth opportunities.

sublists: Sustainability in tourism and hospitality management
Operations management in tourism and resort operations
Employability and development in the hospitality industry
Entrepreneurship in tourism and hospitality management

section.title: Career progression
content: Our hospitality management course gives you a wide range of skills, from food and beverage supply chain management, accounting and cost control, marketing in hotel and leisure to people management, social responsibility and so much more.
Once you’ve completed the course, you’ll be able to apply for senior positions at hotels, restaurants, resorts, and other associated properties in the hotel and hospitality industry around the world.

section.title: University progression
content: Once you've completed your online Level 4 & 5 hospitality management course, you can progress to a third-year 'BA top-up' degree at various UK universities, studying either online or on-campus.
Below are some universities offering hospitality degree top-up programmes:

title: Level 4 & 5  Human Resource Management
description: Dream of leading talent acquisition and fostering workplace excellence? From recruitment and employee development to organisational strategy and compliance – our Human Resource Management Course can set you on the path to success.
subtitle: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free.
subtitle2: From £120 per month, or £2,900 per level
subtitle3: From £145 per month, or £3,500 for both levels

section.title: How it Works
content: Students can complete a Level 4 IAB Diploma (120 credits), Level 5 (120 credits), or combined Level 4 & 5 (240 credits) diploma in Human Resource Management, gaining industry-relevant skills.

This fully online HR qualification offers complete flexibility with no fixed start dates. Each module (Level 4 & 5) includes 40 hours of guided learning plus 30-50 hours of optional materials (exercises, readings, digital resources, and self-tests).

Assessment involves submitting 10 assignments at Level 4 and 6 at Level 5 (each 2,000-3,000 words). Successful students earn a Level 4 IAB and Level 5 Qualifi HR diploma, with progression opportunities to bachelor's degrees at UK universities.

You'll receive comprehensive support including 1-2-1 tutor sessions, webinars, learning forums, and study materials throughout your HRM diploma. Visit our Student Resources page for full details of our academic credentials and support services.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Human Resource Management Content
modules1: The Level 4 Diploma in Human Resource Management includes 10 modules that provide foundational knowledge and skills for managing people and organisational culture.

sublists.name: Culture and the Organisation
sublists.description: Understand organisational culture and its influence on operations.

sublists.name: Developing Interpersonal Skills
sublists.description: Explore and enhance interpersonal skills needed for effective management.

sublists.name: Managing and Rewarding Performance
sublists.description: Learn to manage performance through discipline and reward systems.

sublists.name: Managing Ethically
sublists.description: Examine ethical challenges and the legal context of ethical management.

sublists.name: Managing People in Organisations
sublists.description: Learn training methods and reasons for staff development in organisations.

sublists.name: Motivating and Influencing People
sublists.description: Discover techniques to motivate and influence individuals and teams.

sublists.name: Organisation Structures
sublists.description: Understand structural design factors and their impact on strategy.

sublists.name: Recruitment and CPD
sublists.description: Study recruitment processes, employment contracts, and personal development.

sublists.name: Strategic Human Resource Development
sublists.description: Analyse labour markets, discrimination, and termination practices in HR strategy.

sublists.name: Working in Teams
sublists.description: Understand the dynamics of team membership and leadership.

modules2: The Level 5 Diploma in Human Resource Management includes 10 modules that develop strategic and analytical HR management skills for modern workplaces.

sublists.name: The Entrepreneurial Manager
sublists.description: Explore the qualities and roles of entrepreneurs in business.

sublists.name: Organisation Structures
sublists.description: Review organisational models and factors influencing structure.

sublists.name: Practical Accounting Analysis
sublists.description: Gain insights from accounting data and understand business implications.

sublists.name: Business Planning and Goal Setting
sublists.description: Set clear objectives and develop actionable business plans.

sublists.name: Politics and Business
sublists.description: Assess the impact of political and economic factors on business.

sublists.name: Business Law
sublists.description: Understand the legal responsibilities and frameworks for business managers.

sublists.name: Managing in Today’s World
sublists.description: Explore governance and equality in the context of modern business.

sublists.name: Performance Management
sublists.description: Learn to align business goals with employee development and reward systems.

sublists.name: Marketing and Sales Planning
sublists.description: Create cohesive plans by analysing market, customers, and competitors.

sublists.name: Quantitative Skills
sublists.description: Apply numeric analysis to solve business problems and inform decisions.

sublists: Responding to the Changing Business Environment

section.title: Entry requirements
content: To enrol in our Level 4 Human Resource Management online course, you must be at least 18 years old and have a full secondary education, meaning you must have a minimum of 2 A-levels or equivalent.

If you don’t have 2 A-levels or the equivalent, such as NVQ Level 3, you may also be able to enrol based on your work experience. To find out more, talk to one of our helpful team members at: 0333 772 1158
To enrol on the Level 5 Human Resource Management online course, you must have completed the Level 4 Qualifi diploma in Human Resource Management.

content: Enrol with a £20 deposit and then £120 a month for 24 months, interest-free.

title: Level 4 & 5  Logistics and Chain Supply Management
description: Interested in optimising supply chains and managing global logistics? From procurement and inventory management to transportation and distribution, our Logistics and Supply Chain Management Course can set you on the path to success.
subtitle: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free.
subtitle2: From £120 per month, or £2,900 per level
subtitle3: From £145 per month, or £3,500 for both levels

section.title: How it Works
content: Students on our Logistics and Supply Chain Management course can complete a Level 4 (120 credits), Level 5 (120 credits) or a combined Level 4 & 5 (240 credits) Qualifi diploma, designed to provide students with the skills needed to succeed in the logistics industry.

The course is completed online and you can start at any time, it's completely flexible. Each module (Level 4 & Level 5) consists of 40 hours of guided online learning, with an additional 30-50 hours worth of optional materials that include recommended exercises, readings, digital resources and self-test tasks.

To complete the course you'll submit 6 online assignments at each level, and assignments are approximately 2,000-3,000 words each. Once you've passed your course, you'll be awarded with a Qualifi diploma and you'll be able to top up your qualification to a bachelor's degree at a range of UK universities.

During the Logistics and Supply Chain Management course you'll have access to 1-2-1 tutor support and webinars, social learning forums and additional materials to complete your diploma with ease. You can find out more about the support you'll have available on our Student Resources page. You can also read about the academic credentials we meet and associations we're part of to make sure you have the best learning experience.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Logistics and Business Management Content
modules1: The Level 4 Diploma in Logistics and Supply Chain Management includes 6 modules that build core competencies in logistics, operations, finance, and communication.

sublists.name: Academic Writing and Research Skills
sublists.description: Develop proficiency in academic writing and research through comprehensive instruction and practical application, fostering essential skills for comprehensive communication and critical analysis.

sublists.name: Logistics and the Business Environment
sublists.description: Explore the intersection of logistics and the business environment, examining strategies and challenges to optimise supply chain efficiency in today’s dynamic market landscape.

sublists.name: Operations and Logistics Management
sublists.description: A comprehensive study of operations and logistics management, covering strategic planning, resource optimisation, and supply chain efficiency for effective business operations.

sublists.name: Finance and Accounting
sublists.description: A deep understanding of finance and accounting principles, fostering the analytical skills needed for sound financial decision-making in diverse business environments.

sublists.name: Communication in Business
sublists.description: Examine the dynamics of effective communication in business, emphasising interpersonal, written, and presentation skills crucial for professional success and organizational effectiveness.

sublists.name: Leading and Managing Teams
sublists.description: Develop leadership and team management skills, exploring strategies for effective collaboration, motivation, and decision-making to drive success in diverse organizational settings.

modules2: The Level 5 Diploma in Business Management includes 10 modules designed to equip learners with managerial, legal, analytical, and leadership skills.

sublists.name: The Entrepreneurial Manager
sublists.description: What is an entrepreneur? Examine the skills and qualities of entrepreneurship.

sublists.name: Organisation Structures
sublists.description: Examine organizational structure models and theories to understand optimal configurations for different business types.

sublists.name: Practical Accounting Analysis
sublists.description: Engage in hands-on accounting exercises to derive insights and guide business actions through financial analysis.

sublists.name: Business Planning and Goal Setting
sublists.description: Focus on defining objectives and creating actionable plans to achieve strategic business outcomes.

sublists.name: Politics and Business
sublists.description: Understand the influence of politics on business operations, including economic impact and government involvement.

sublists.name: Business Law
sublists.description: Explore legal responsibilities of managers and the regulatory framework governing businesses.

sublists.name: Managing in Today’s World
sublists.description: Examine governance, equality, and ethical considerations in modern business management.

sublists.name: Performance Management
sublists.description: Review reward systems, training, and continuous development strategies to enhance organizational performance.

sublists.name: Marketing and Sales Planning
sublists.description: Learn how to develop strategic marketing plans that align products, markets, and customers.

sublists.name: Quantitative Skills
sublists.description: Build proficiency in numeric analysis and apply quantitative tools within business contexts.

sublists: Responding to the Changing Business Environment

If you don’t have 2 A-levels or the equivalent, such as NVQ Level 3, you may also be able to enrol based on your work experience. To find out more, talk to one of our helpful team members at: 0333 772 1158

section.title: Career progression
content: Level 4 and 5 qualifications in Logistics and Supply Chain Management can lead to a variety of mid-to-senior level careers in the field. These roles include positions like Supply Chain Analyst, Logistics Coordinator, Operations Manager, , and Inventory Manager.
With these qualifications, you could also work as a Warehouse Manager or Distribution Manager, overseeing logistics operations and ensuring efficient supply chain processes.
These roles typically involve managing logistics strategies, optimizing supply chain operations, and coordinating with suppliers and customers to ensure smooth and cost-effective delivery of goods.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: IT and Computing Content
modules1: The Level 4 Diploma in IT and Computing includes 10 modules focused on foundational technical knowledge, systems understanding, and application development.

sublists.name: Computer Systems and Software
sublists.description: Develop learners’ understanding of the integration of hardware and software components.

sublists.name: Computer Programming
sublists.description: Use different tools and techniques to design, implement, and test programs, following the system life cycle.

sublists.name: Relational Database Systems
sublists.description: Develop understanding of database systems, data analysis, and data modeling.

sublists.name: Software Engineering
sublists.description: Gain understanding of the need for software engineering and the various methods and techniques involved.

sublists.name: Systems Analysis and Design
sublists.description: Understand IS concepts and how they relate to business processes and information transformation.

sublists.name: E-commerce Applications
sublists.description: Explore the role of e-commerce in business, identifying aims, objectives, and associated design considerations.

sublists.name: Human-Computer Interaction
sublists.description: Understand HCI principles and evaluate existing designs to plan a prototype multimedia interface.

sublists.name: IT and Society
sublists.description: Examine the impact of technology on society and trends, including data security and management issues.

sublists.name: Information Systems Theory and Practice
sublists.description: Explore key project management elements required for successful IT project development and implementation.

sublists.name: Management Information Systems
sublists.description: Understand how information systems support business needs in data and information processing.

modules2: The Level 5 Diploma in IT and Computing features 10 modules that deepen technical proficiency and prepare learners for strategic and development roles in the IT sector.

sublists.name: Innovative Technologies in Computing
sublists.description: Explore disruptive advances and the emerging skills needed for future computing careers.

sublists.name: Computing Research Methods
sublists.description: Gain research skills including qualitative and quantitative methods, literature review, and proposal design.

sublists.name: Software Development Methodologies
sublists.description: Study the role of systems engineering and modeling approaches in software development.

sublists.name: Managing a Computing Project
sublists.description: Understand and apply tools and techniques for effectively managing IT projects.

sublists.name: Strategic Management Information Systems
sublists.description: Learn about the strategic impact of MIS and its alignment with organizational goals.

sublists.name: Ethical, Legal and Professional Issues in IT
sublists.description: Explore issues related to IT security, privacy, confidentiality, and regulatory compliance.

sublists.name: Network Design
sublists.description: Understand the principles, implementation, and support of network systems.

sublists.name: Web Based Development
sublists.description: Design, deploy, and manage virtualization solutions and evaluate their business impact.

sublists.name: Cyber Security
sublists.description: Develop awareness of digital security principles, industry standards, and security enhancement strategies.

sublists.name: Database Design and Development
sublists.description: Research, design, and implement complex databases using modern DBMS tools.

sublists: Computer Graphics Editing and Database Concepts

This flexible online course allows you to start anytime. Each module includes 40 hours of guided learning plus 30-50 hours of optional materials (exercises, readings, digital resources, and self-tests).
You'll submit 6 assignments per level (each 2,000-3,000 words). Upon completion, receive a Qualifi diploma with progression opportunities to bachelor's degrees at UK universities.
Benefit from 1-2-1 tutor support, webinars, learning forums, and study materials throughout your diploma. Visit our Student Resources page for details on our academic standards and support services.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: IT and Networking Content
modules1: The Level 4 Diploma in IT and Computing includes 10 modules aimed at foundational understanding of IT systems, programming, and human-technology interaction.

sublists.name: Computer Systems and Software
sublists.description: Develop learners’ understanding of the integration of hardware and software components.

sublists.name: Computer Programming
sublists.description: Use tools and techniques to design, implement, and test programs, following the system life cycle.

sublists.name: Relational Database Systems
sublists.description: Develop understanding of database systems and data analysis and modelling.

sublists.name: Software Engineering
sublists.description: Understand the need for software engineering and different methods and techniques.

sublists.name: Systems Analysis and Design
sublists.description: Understand IS concepts and their relevance to business processes and information transformation.

sublists.name: E-commerce Applications
sublists.description: Explore the role of e-commerce in businesses and design considerations based on requirements.

sublists.name: Human Computer Interaction
sublists.description: Understand HCI principles and evaluate existing designs to plan a prototype multimedia user interface.

sublists.name: IT and Society
sublists.description: Examine the societal impact of technology and issues around security and data management.

sublists.name: Information Systems Theory and Practice
sublists.description: Explore project management elements for effective IT project implementation.

sublists.name: Management Information Systems
sublists.description: Understand how information systems support business information and data processing needs.

modules2: The Level 5 Diploma focuses on specialized knowledge in tech entrepreneurship, network administration, and dynamic web systems.

sublists.name: Technopreneurship
sublists.description: Gain knowledge and skills to start a tech business, covering entrepreneurship, planning, marketing, and finance.

sublists.name: Network Security
sublists.description: Understand security issues in networks and methods for prevention and detection of incidents.

sublists.name: C#.NET Programming
sublists.description: Learn ASP.NET programming using C# to create dynamic server-side web applications.

sublists.name: System Administration
sublists.description: Understand the role and key responsibilities of system administration.

sublists.name: Network Routing and Switching
sublists.description: Gain skills to configure routers and switches for multi-area network interconnections.

sublists.name: Network Design and Administration
sublists.description: Learn to design scalable networks and address performance issues in hierarchical network designs.

sublists: Computer Graphics Editing and Database Concepts

section.title: Entry requirements
content: To enrol on our Level 4 IT and Computing course, you must be at least 18 years old and have a full secondary education, meaning you must have a minimum of 2 A-levels or equivalent.

If you don’t have 2 A-levels or the equivalent, such as NVQ Level 3, you may also be able to enrol based on your work experience. To find out more, talk to one of our helpful team members at: 0333 772 1158
To enrol on the Level 5 IT & Networking course, you must have completed the Level 4 Qualifi diploma in IT and Computing.

content: Enrol with a £20 deposit and then £120 a month for 24 months, interest-free.

content: Whilst studying this course students will develop their skills in programming, systems analysis and design, software development. Upon successful completion of the course, students can pursue a career in IT within the public or private sector.

section.title: How it Works
content: Students on our IT and Web Design course can complete a Level 4 (120 credits), Level 5 (120 credits) or a combined Level 4 & 5 (240 credits) Qualifi diploma, gaining essential web development and IT skills.

This fully online program offers complete flexibility with no fixed start dates. Each module includes 40 hours of guided learning plus 30-50 hours of optional materials (exercises, readings, digital resources, and self-tests).

You'll submit 10 assignments at Level 4 and 6 at Level 5 (each 2,000-3,000 words). Upon completion, you'll receive a Qualifi diploma with opportunities to progress to bachelor's degrees at UK universities.

Benefit from comprehensive support including 1-2-1 tutoring, webinars, learning forums, and study resources. Visit our Student Resources page for details on our academic standards and professional affiliations.

title: Level 4 & 5 Sales and Marketing
description: Dream of driving sales growth and crafting compelling marketing strategies? From sales techniques and customer relationship management to digital marketing and brand development – our Sales and Marketing Course can set you on the path to success.
subtitle: Enrol today for £20 and spread the cost over 24 months interest free.
subtitle2: From £120 per month, or £2,900 per level
subtitle3: From £145 per month, or £3,500 for both levels

section.title: How it Works
content: Students on our Sales and Marketing course can complete a Level 4 (120 credits), Level 5 (120 credits) or combined Level 4 & 5 (240 credits) diploma, gaining essential marketing and sales skills for industry success.

This flexible online program offers anytime enrollment. Each module includes 40 hours of guided learning plus 30-50 hours of optional materials (exercises, readings, digital resources, and self-tests).

You'll submit 10 assignments at Level 4 and 6 at Level 5 (each 2,000-3,000 words). Graduates receive both IAB and Qualifi diplomas, with progression opportunities to bachelor's degrees at UK universities.

Access comprehensive support including 1-2-1 tutoring, webinars, learning forums, and study resources. Visit our Student Resources page for details on our accreditations and learning support services.

section.title: Course Modules
section.heading: Sales and Marketing Content
modules1: The Level 4 Diploma in Sales and Marketing introduces key concepts in business environments, customer relations, IT usage in business, and foundational marketing strategies.

sublists.name: The Business Environment
sublists.description: Explore an organization's internal and external surroundings, and how these influence business operations.

sublists.name: Customers and Customer Service
sublists.description: Understand how customers make purchasing decisions and the role of customer service in marketing.

sublists.name: Marketing Mix
sublists.description: Analyze external and operational variables that affect marketing strategy and execution.

sublists.name: Marketing and Sales Planning
sublists.description: Learn the importance of sales and marketing strategies across various sectors including non-profit organizations.

sublists.name: IT in Business
sublists.description: Discover how Information Technology can be used to gain competitive advantage through internal and external business processes.

sublists.name: Managing and Using Marketing
sublists.description: Gain an introduction to marketing principles applicable across all sectors of the economy.

sublists.name: Customers and Their Needs
sublists.description: Identify and satisfy customer needs by building strong business-customer relationships.

sublists.name: E-marketing Communications
sublists.description: Examine the role of the internet and digital tools in transforming traditional marketing activities.

sublists.name: High Performance Sales
sublists.description: Understand how sales performance drives organizational success and growth.

sublists.name: Marketing Strategy
sublists.description: Learn how organizations develop, assess, and implement effective marketing strategies.

modules2: The Level 5 Diploma builds on foundational knowledge, developing skills in entrepreneurship, accounting, planning, and strategic management.

sublists.name: The Entrepreneurial Manager
sublists.description: Examine the traits and skills required for successful entrepreneurship.

sublists.name: Organisation Structures
sublists.description: Explore models and theories that explain how businesses are structured.

sublists.name: Practical Accounting Analysis
sublists.description: Understand how to interpret financial statements and take informed business decisions.

sublists.name: Business Planning and Goal Setting
sublists.description: Learn to formulate clear business objectives and actionable plans to achieve them.

sublists.name: Politics and Business
sublists.description: Study the impact of political factors on business, including exports and government policy.

sublists.name: Business Law
sublists.description: Understand the legal responsibilities of business managers and the regulatory environment.

sublists.name: Managing in Today’s World
sublists.description: Examine governance and equality in modern business practices.

sublists.name: Performance Management
sublists.description: Learn how continuous improvement is achieved through training, CPD, and reward structures.

sublists.name: Marketing and Sales Planning
sublists.description: Analyze how markets, customers, products, and competition align within a cohesive marketing plan.

sublists.name: Quantitative Skills
sublists.description: Develop competency in numeric exercises essential for business decision-making.

section.title: Entry requirements
content: To enrol in our Level 4 Sales and Marketing course, you must be at least 18 years old and have a full secondary education, meaning you must have a minimum of 2 A-levels or equivalent.

If you don’t have 2 A-levels or the equivalent, such as NVQ Level 3, you may also be able to enrol based on your work experience. To find out more, talk to one of our helpful team members at: 0333 772 1158
To enrol on the Level 5 Sales and Marketing course, you must have completed the Level 4 Qualifi diploma in Sales and Marketing.

content: Successful completion of the undergraduate Level 4 Diploma in Sales and Marketing and Level 5 Diploma in Business Management and final year of an accredited undergraduate degree programme will give students the right credentials to go on and apply for a job in marketing, sales, human resources, management or business consultancy.
